posts.name: JAMES
posts.cooked: I recently installed the revlib for VS code and it gave me errors so I followed a different thread and cleaned my java workspace. That broke the Build.Gradle file. Any solutions?

posts.name: Yishai Levy
posts.cooked: Hello! I’d love if you could elaborate on your problem. Which errors exactly? What exactly do you mean by “broke the Build.Gradle file”? What did you do to clean up you Java workspace?

posts.name: Galen Spooner
posts.cooked: I had a similar problem not 5 minutes ago when installing REVlib. I found that it was because the REV website for some reason still gives you the link for online installation of the 2023 REVlib, not 2024. Here’s the link to 2024 if you have 2023 installed: https://software-metadata.revrobotics.com/REVLib-2024.json

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC 2035 Captain, Software Lead, Driver, Design

posts.cooked: Can also get the up to date version from WPILib Docs. 3rd Party Libraries — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: 3rd Party Libraries — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.custom_user_title: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.cooked:
are you sure you have the right version? The REV website still links you to the 2023 (old) version. You should uninstall the library, and perform an online install with this link

https://software-metadata.revrobotics.com/REVLib-2024.json

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
GalenSpooner:

I found that it was because the REV website for some reason still gives you the link for online installation of the 2023 REVlib, not 2024.

manso:

The REV website still links you to the 2023 (old) version.

I’m sure Rev would appreciate knowing where you guys found old links. I couldn’t find it after a few minutes of searching around.

If you go to:

The website only mentions the 2023 version: image 798×294 18.8 KB

image 798×294 18.8 KB

image 798×294 18.8 KB

and if you scroll down a bit (just skipping past the LabVIEW guide): image 870×584 43.9 KB

image 870×584 43.9 KB

image 870×584 43.9 KB

If you copy that link they give you, and change the number to 2024, it will give you the correct library version

https://software-metadata.revrobotics.com/REVLib-2024.json

posts.name: Galen Spooner
posts.cooked:
I’m surprised you were unable to find it as REVLib Information | SPARK MAX (which contains links to 2023 revlib) is the first result when I search “revlib” Screenshot_20240615-203822 1080×1748 158 KB
